page.title: 05 Crossway Garage, Coleford
page.content: The owner told us it was built in 1963 . He told us that there was another garage near Crossway, but the petrol tanks were too near the road. He told us what was here before the garage. There was a shed where people made blocks and where they put the coal lorry. Stephen asked him what kind of work he did and the owner said "Everything concerning cars but not motor bikes because if they fall over they scratch the paint work on the cars next to them". He told us how many hours a day he works. He works nine and a half hours a day. I asked him how many machines he uses and he said," One lift, two pits, one hoist, one brake tester, one beam setter, and some small hand tools, one compresser, wheel balancer, and a battery charger".
